Message.Title: DC sends Walmart packing
Message.Msg: the epitome of stupidity. Washington DC and Walmart had a deal. Waldmart was going to build 6 stores in some of poorest neighborhoods of DC. 3 stores are already under construction. So the DC council has the bright idea that it would be right and just to pass a law the requires Walmart and similar large stores to pay a minimum wage of $12.50 her hour which is $4 over the current min. wage of $8.50. Mind you all of this came up after Walmart had a deal and started contruction on 3 stores. Walmart threatened to leave if the bill passed. DC council didn't care. Yesterday it passed 8-5. The mayor might veto but already the DC council is looking to override that veto. True to its threat, Walmart cancelled plans to build the 3 stores not already under construction. And the ones currently under construction may be doomed as well. This is how liberals think folks. Now DC residents will not have access to low prices and a lot of people won't have jobs. Good thinking DC. That's the way you help folks.

Message.Title: the largest food stamp recipient in the nation is walmart
Message.Msg: walmart, the largest food stamp recipient Alan Grayson says more Walmart employees on Medicaid, food stamps than other companies the politifact truthmeter rates that claim Mostly True. walmart, the largest food stamp recipient Their low wages force employees to need approximately $420,000 per year, per store, totaling $2.66 BILLION annually in food stamps and other taxpayer assistance…to survive. low wages cost the country HUNDREDS OF MILLIONS of dollars in payroll tax deductions for Federal, State, and Local taxes. low wages cost our communities the ability to hire and retain important public service workers like firefighters, police officers, maintenance workers, and teachers. low wages cost our communities with their increased need for those same public services they are underfunding. low wages and lack of covered benefits cost taxpayers over $1.02 BILLION a year in healthcare costs. low wages cost taxpayers as much as $225 MILLION in free and reduced price lunches for school-age children. low wages cost taxpayers over $780 MILLION in tax deductions for low-income families.

Topic.Title: Seriously... the prosecution has presented as good a case FOR Zimmerman....

Message.Msg: I don't think they made a case of manslaughter either...... Manslaughter is a unique charge because it does not require intent... but it does require the outcome of your actions to be foreseeable Evidence points to Martin attacking Zimmerman and gaining the upper hand... an armed Zimmerman reacted with deadly force to an altercation that he did not know was going to take place... no evidence was presented of menacing with a weapon... brandishing a firearm... etc... the gun did not come out till after Zimmerman was hit Self defense IF anything should have been foreseeable it should have been that Martin was taking a great risk in attacking a stranger whom he did not know was armed or not Libs say that Martin had a right to be in that community... what they fail to acknowledge is that Zimmerman had the very same right and he also had the right to walk (follow) in Martins path

Message.Title: Walmart is a Job Killer
Message.Msg: Fact: Walmart is a Job Killer ◦Walmart store openings destroy almost three local jobs for every two they create by reducing retail employment by an average of 2.7 percent in every county they enter.[1] ◦Walmart cost America an estimated 196,000 jobs – mainly manufacturing jobs – between 2001 and 2006 as a result of the company’s imports from China.[2] Fact: Walmart Jobs Are Poverty Jobs •Walmart workers average just $8.81 hour.[3] This translates to annual pay of $15,576, based upon Walmart’s full-time status of 34 hours per week.[4] This is less than 70% of the poverty line for a family of four.[5] -

Topic.Title: Walmart is a Job Killer

Message.Msg: FRAUD: Walmart Jobs Are Poverty Jobs •Walmart workers average just $8.81 hour.[3] This translates to annual pay of $15,576, based upon Walmart’s full-time status of 34 hours per week.[4] This is less than 70% of the poverty line for a family of four.[5] Q1: Why are we comparing Walmart pay for one person to the Federal Poverty Level for a family of four? Couldn't at least one other person in a family of four be able to work? This study was done for DC, where the average household has an average of 2.1 people. For the USA it is only 2.6 persons per household (Census Quick Facts). So why are we assuming that Walmart pay for one person must support a family of four? Q2: When people blabber about the "Federal Poverty Level" it allows them to obscure what numbers they are implying. Here are the Federal Poverty Levels for 1, 2, 3 & 4. Notice the pay rate they work out to using 2000 hours per year (a standard 40 hour week X 50 weeks.) 1, $11,490, $5.75 2, $15,510, $7.76 3, $19,530, $9.77 4, $23,550, $11.78 Note that the Federal minimum wage is $7.25 per hour. It USE TO BE $5.25 per hour. So the Federal Poverty Levels have not bee upgraded sine the Federal Minimum wage was increased to $7.25 as of July 24, 2009. (BTW: $7.25 per hour X 2000 hours = $14,500 for one person. So in theory, no one person in America can work full time and be under the Federal Poverty Level for 1.) Note also that the Walmart wage of $8.81 per hour is 26% higher than the Federal minimum wage of $7.25 per hour. It is also about 13.5% higher than the federal Poverty level for a household of 2. It is only about 10% under the poverty level for a family of 3. Note also that if both of the 2 people in a household of 2 worked at Walmart, they would jointly earn $31,152 which is 32.2% higher than the poverty level for a household of 4.

Topic.Title: Walmart is a Job Killer

Message.Msg: The above references a time period of 2001 to 2006: During that time I worked at a part time job at PetsMart for less than $8.81 per hour. At that time market rate minimum pay was about $8 per hour even though the federal minimum was only $5.25 per hour. My pay started at $6.50 per hour in 2002. I ended at $8.25 per hour in 2008.

Message.Title: former Sanford FLA Police Chief...
Message.Msg: states the obvious....what we already knew. The George Zimmerman investigation was hijacked "in a number of ways" by outside forces, said the former police chief of Sanford, Florida. Bill Lee, who testified Monday in Zimmerman's second-degree murder trial, told CNN's George Howell in an exclusive interview that he felt pressure from city officials to arrest Zimmerman to placate the public rather than as a matter of justice. "It was (relayed) to me that they just wanted an arrest. They didn't care if it got dismissed later," he said. "You don't do that."

Message.Title: Zimmerman lawyers says following people with a loaded gun is just fine
Message.Msg: Zimmerman defense team knows they will lose because the fight was all Zimmerman's choice. Zimmerman chose to follow. Knowing this the lawyer tried to make the judge instructed the jury that following people who are not doing any wrong is perfectly acceptable behavior. But it isn't, ALL watch programs say not to. Following like Zimmerman did proves he was looking for trouble and the fault lies with him. SANFORD, Florida (Reuters) - The judge presiding over the murder trial of George Zimmerman denied a defense request on Thursday that jurors be instructed the neighborhood watch volunteer did nothing illegal in deciding to follow Trayvon Martin, before the encounter in which he shot and killed the unarmed black teenager. "I am not giving that instruction," Seminole County Judge Debra Nelson told Zimmerman defense lawyer Don West, who said no Florida law makes it illegal to follow somebody and that the proposed jury instruction was key to Zimmerman's self-defense case.
